# tasks file for rofi
- name: rofi Tasks
  debug:
    msg: "Starting rofi tasks"

- name: Ensure rofi directories exist
  file:
    dest: "{{ rofi_directory_default_location }}/{{ item.dest }}"
    state: directory
    owner: "{{ item.owner | default(omit) }}"
    group: "{{ item.group | default(omit) }}"
    mode: "{{ item.mode | default(omit) }}"
    recurse: "{{ item.recurse | default(false) }}"
  loop: "{{ rofi_directory_definitions }}"
  check_mode: no
  tags: ['profile']

- name: Synchronize templates - rofi
  template:
    src: "{{ item }}.j2"
    dest: "{{ user.home }}/.config/rofi/{{ item }}"
    owner: "{{ user.name }}"
    group: "{{ user.group }}"
    mode: preserve
    backup: yes
  with_items:
    - config.rasi
    - gruvbox-common.rasi
    - gruvbox-dark-hard.rasi
    - colors/onedark.rasi
    - scripts/launcher_main.sh
    - scripts/launcher_t1.sh
    - scripts/launcher_t4.sh
    - launchers/type-1/shared/colors.rasi
    - launchers/type-1/shared/fonts.rasi
    - launchers/type-1/style-8.rasi
    - launchers/type-1/style-10.rasi
    - launchers/type-4/shared/colors.rasi
    - launchers/type-4/shared/fonts.rasi
    - launchers/type-4/style-6.rasi
  tags: ['profile', 'rofi', 'menus']

---

# tasks file for Barrier
- name: Barrier Tasks
  debug:
    msg: "Starting Barrier tasks"

- name: Ensure folders for barrier configs exist
  file:
    path: "{{ item }}"
    state: directory
    owner: "{{ user.name }}"
    group: "{{ user.group }}"
  with_items:
    - "{{ user.home }}/.config/Debauchee"
    - "{{ user.home }}/.config/autostart"

- name: Set barrier server config
  copy:
    src: home/.config/Debauchee/{{ inventory_hostname }}.conf
    dest: "{{ user.home }}/.config/Debauchee/{{ inventory_hostname }}.conf"
    owner: "{{ user.name }}"
    group: "{{ user.group }}"
    mode: '0644'
    backup: yes
  when: barrier.server is defined

# - name: Set barrier server autostart
#   template:
#     src: "home/.config/autostart/barrier-server.desktop.j2"

# handlers file for user

  remote_user: root

---
# tasks file for user

- name: User Tasks
  debug:
    msg: "Starting user tasks"

- name: Add user to groups
  user:
    name: "{{ user.name }}"
    groups: "video,audio,input"
    append: yes
  tags: ['groups']


- block:
    - name: Check if keys are present
      stat:
        path: "{{ user.home }}/.ssh/id_ed25519"
      register: keys

    - name: Start ssh daemon
      service:
        name: sshd
        state: started
        enabled: True

    - name: Copy keys from remote host
      delegate_to: 127.0.0.1
      run_once: True
      become_user: "{{ user.name }}"
      shell: "scp {{ user.name }}@{{ keyserver }}:~/.ssh/{{ item }} {{ user.home }}/.ssh/{{ item }}"
      args:
        chdir: "{{ user.home }}"
      with_items:
        - id_ed25519
        - id_ed25519.pub
        - config
        - known_hosts
        - authorized_keys
      when:
        - not keys.stat.exists
        - newInstall is defined

  tags: ["keys"]

---
# handlers file for roles/distro

- name: Update pacman cache
  pacman:
    update_cache: True
    upgrade: False

- name: Update pacman mirrors
  shell: |
    reflector --download-timeout 2 --protocol https \
    --latest 20 --sort rate --score 15 --fastest 12 \
    --save /etc/pacman.d/mirrorlist
  ignore_errors: True

---
- hosts: localhost
  remote_user: root
  roles:
    - roles/distro

---

- name: Current packages installed
  shell: |
    paru -Q |awk '{print $1}'
  become: False
  register: arch_installed_packages
  check_mode: no
  tags: ['packages']

- block:
    - name: install packages
      aur:
        use: paru
        name: "{{ packages|difference(arch_installed_packages.stdout) }}"
        state: present
        extra_args: "--overwrite '*'"
      become: False
      when: arch_installed_packages | length > 0
      tags: ['packages']

  rescue:
    - name: Handle installation failure
      debug:
        msg: "Failed to install a package. Check the logs."

  always:
    - name: Continue executions
      debug:
        msg: "Continuing with playbook execution."

  become: False
  tags: ['packages']


- block:
    - name: Install host specific xorg packages
      aur:
        use: paru
        name: "{{ host.xorg.video|difference(arch_installed_packages.stdout) }}"
        state: present
        extra_args: "--overwrite '*'"
      when: host.xorg.video is defined

  rescue:
    - name: Handle installation failure
      debug:
        msg: "Failed to install a package. Check the logs."

  always:
    - name: Continue executions
      debug:
        msg: "Continuing with playbook execution."      

  become: False
  tags: ["x"]

---

- name: Check if mirrors have been updated within the past 24h
  shell: "fd --changed-within 24hours --search-path=/etc/pacman.d"
  register: mirror_status
  tags: ["mirrors"]

- name: Print mirror file status
  debug:
    msg: "{{ mirror_status }}"
  when:
    - ( mirror_status.stdout_lines | length < 0 or update_mirrors is defined )
    - debugging is defined
  tags: ["mirrors"]

---

- name: Check if paru installed
  stat:
    path: /usr/bin/paru
  register: paru
  tags: ['packages']

- name: Install paru if not installed
  block:
    - name: Install paru
      pacman:
        name: paru
        state: present
        force: yes
        extra_args: --noconfirm
      register: paru_package
      until: "paru_package is not failed"
      retries: 2
      delay: 10

  rescue:
    - name: Clone paru
      git:
        repo: "https://aur.archlinux.org/paru.git"
        dest: "/tmp/paru"
        accept_hostkey: yes
        update: yes
        force: no
      become: False

    - name: Make and install paru
      shell: "makepkg -si --noconfirm --needed"
      args:
        chdir: "/tmp/paru"
      become: False

    - name: clean and update package cache
      shell: "paru -Sc --noconfirm && paru -Syy"
      become: False

  when: not paru.stat.exists
  tags: ['packages']

- name: Adjust paru config
  template:
    src: etc/paru.conf.j2
    dest: /etc/paru.conf
    mode: '0644'
    backup: True
  # ignore_errors: "{{ ansible_check_mode }}"

---

# - name: Import primary key - chaotic
#   command: pacman-key --recv-key 3056513887B78AEB --keyserver keyserver.ubuntu.com
#   register: importkey
#   changed_when: false
#
# - name: Sign primary key - chaotic
#   command: pacman-key --lsign-key 3056513887B78AEB
#   register: signkey
#   changed_when: false

- name: Install chaotic keyring and mirrorlist
  shell: |
    pacman -U 'https://cdn-mirror.chaotic.cx/chaotic-aur/chaotic-keyring.pkg.tar.zst' --noconfirm && \
    pacman -U 'https://cdn-mirror.chaotic.cx/chaotic-aur/chaotic-mirrorlist.pkg.tar.zst' --noconfirm
  changed_when: false

- name: Check pacman.conf contents
  command: cat /etc/pacman.conf
  register: pacman_conf_output
  changed_when: false

- name: Add chaotic mirror list
  copy:
    src: etc/pacman.d/chaotic-mirrorlist
    dest: /etc/pacman.d/chaotic-mirrorlist
    owner: root
    group: root
    mode: '0644'
    backup: True

- name: Add repository to pacman.conf
  lineinfile:
    path: /etc/pacman.conf
    line: |
      [chaotic-aur]
      Include = /etc/pacman.d/chaotic-mirrorlist
    insertafter: EOF
  when: "'[chaotic-aur]' not in pacman_conf_output.stdout"
  changed_when: false
  failed_when: false
  register: pacman_conf_add

- name: Update cache
  pacman:
    update_cache: True
    upgrade: False

---
#setup repositories
- name: Starting distro tasks
  debug:
    var: ansible_os_family
  tags: ['always']

- name: install reflector package
  pacman:
    name: "{{ item }}"
    state: present
    force: yes
    extra_args: --noconfirm
  with_items:
    - aria2
    - fd
    - reflector
    - ripgrep

- block:

        id: 762AE5DB2B38786364BD81C4B9141BCC62D38EE5
        url: https://arch.osamc.de/proaudio/osamc.gpg
        state: present
      register: archaudio_keys
      tags: ["repo"]

    - name: Set pacman.conf config
      template:
        src: etc/pacman.conf.j2
        dest: /etc/pacman.conf
        mode: "0644"
        backup: True
      tags: ["pacman"]

    - name: Set makepkg to use aria2
      template:
        src: etc/makepkg.conf.j2
        dest: /etc/makepkg.conf
        mode: "0644"
        backup: True
      tags: ["makepkg"]

    - import_tasks:
        file: chaotic.yml
      when: chaoticrepo|bool
      tags: ["repo", "chaotic"]

  # when: "{{ install. }}|bool"
  notify:
    - "Update pacman mirrors"
    - "Update pacman cache"

- name: Flush handlers
  meta: flush_handlers

    file: paru.yml
  tags: ["paru"]

---
# handlers file for nfs

- name: reload firewalld
  shell: "firewall-cmd --reload"
  ignore_errors: "{{ ansible_check_mode }}"

---
- hosts: localhost
  remote_user: root
  roles:
    - nfs

---

- name: Ensure group storage exists
  group:
    name: storage
    gid: 1036

- name: Ensure user home exists
  user:
    name: home
    state: present
    shell: /sbin/nologin
    group: storage

- name: Set smb.conf
  copy:
    src: etc/samba/smb.conf
    dest: /etc/samba/smb.conf
    owner: root
    group: root
    mode: '0644'
    backup: True

- name: Permit traffic to samba services
  firewalld:
    service: samba
    permanent: yes
    state: enabled

- name: Enable samba service
  service:
    name: samba
    state: started
    enabled: yes

---

# - name: mount_names
#   set_fact:
#     mount_names: "{{ ansible_mounts | map(attribute='mount') | list}}"
#   tags: ['nfstest']
#
# - debug:
#     var: mount_names
#   loop: "{{ share.nfs.exports }}"
#   failed_when: item not in mount_names
#   tags: ['nfstest']

- name: Create exports folder
  file:
    path: /srv/exports
    state: directory
    owner: "{{ user.name }}"
    group: "{{ user.group }}"
    mode: "2775"
  when: bind_share_exports|bool

- block:
    - name: Ensure group nobody exists
      group:
        name: nobody
        gid: 65534
        non_unique: True
        system: True

    - name: Ensure user nobody exists
      user:
        name: nobody
        system: True
        state: present
        shell: /sbin/nologin
        uid: 65534
        group: nobody

    - name: Install nfs configs
      template:
        src: "etc/{{ item }}.j2"
        dest: "/etc/{{ item }}"
        mode: "0644"
        backup: yes
      with_items:
        - idmapd.conf
        - nfs.conf

    - name: Ensure nfs/rpc services are enabled and started
      service:
        name: "{{ item }}"
        state: restarted
        enabled: yes
      with_items:
        - nfs-server
        - nfs-mountd
        - nfs-idmapd
        - rpcbind

    - block:
        - name: Permit traffic to rpcbind
          firewalld:
            port: "{{ item }}"
            permanent: yes
            state: enabled
          with_items:
            - 111/tcp
            - 111/udp
            - 662/tcp
            - 662/udp
            - 892/tcp
            - 892/udp
            - 2049/tcp
            - 32769/udp
            - 32803/tcp
            - 40418/udp

        - name: reload firewalld
          shell: "firewall-cmd --reload"
          ignore_errors: "{{ ansible_check_mode }}"

      when: ansible_os_family == 'Archlinux'

    - block:
        - name: Permit tcp traffic to rpcbind
          community.general.ufw:
            rule: allow
            port: "{{ item }}"
            proto: tcp
          with_items:
            - "111"
            - "662"
            - "892"
            - "2049"
            - "32803"

        - name: Permit udp traffic to rpcbind
          community.general.ufw:
            rule: allow
            port: "{{ item }}"
            proto: udp
          with_items:
            - "111"
            - "662"
            - "892"
            - "32769"
            - "32803"

      when: ansible_distribution == 'MX' or ansible_distribution == 'Debian'

  ignore_errors: "{{ ansible_check_mode }}"

- name: Ensure the exported folder already exists
  file:
    path: "{{ share.nfs.parent }}/{{ item }}"
    state: directory
    owner: "{{ user.name }}"
    group: "{{ user.group }}"
    mode: '2775'
  with_items:
    - "{{ share.nfs.exports }}"

- name: Create exports folder
  file:
    path: /srv/exports/{{ item }}
    state: directory
    owner: "{{ user.name }}"
    group: "{{ user.group }}"
  with_items:
    - "{{ share.nfs.exports }}"
  when: bind_share_exports|bool

- name: Ensure required entries are made to fstab file
  lineinfile:
    path: /etc/fstab
    state: present
    line: "{{ share.nfs.parent }}/{{ item }} /srv/exports/{{ item }} none bind 0 0"
  with_items:
    - "{{ share.nfs.exports }}"
  register: fstab
  when: bind_share_exports|bool

- name: Reload systemd
  systemd:
    daemon_reload: yes
  when: (fstab.changed or bind_share_exports|bool)

# https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/collections/ansible/posix/mount_module.html#parameter-state
- name: Mount and bind the exports
  ansible.posix.mount:
    path: "/srv/exports/{{ item }}"
    src: "{{ user.home }}/{{ item }}"
    opts: bind
    state: ephemeral
    fstype: none
  with_items: "{{ share.nfs.exports }}"
  ignore_errors: True

# - name: Mounted the binded folders
#   shell: |
#     mount /srv/exports/{{ item }}
#   with_items:
#     - "{{ share.nfs.exports }}"

- name: Set the exports
  template:
    src: etc/exports.j2
    dest: /etc/exports
    owner: root
    group: root
    mode: "0644"
    backup: yes
  register: exportsra

- name: Reload exports
  shell: exportfs -rv
  when: exportsra.changed

---

# generated task file

- name: Set up NFS server
  hosts: nfs_servers
  tasks:
    - name: Create directory for NFS exports
      file:
        path: /srv/exports
        state: directory
        owner: owner_name
        group: group_name
        mode: "0755"

    - name: Ensure 'nobody' user and group exist
      user:
        name: nobody
        group: nobody
        state: present
        system: yes
        non_unique: yes
        uid: 65534
        gid: 65534

    - name: Install NFS configurations
      template:
        src: etc/{{ item }}.j2
        dest: /etc/{{ item }}
      with_items:
        - idmapd.conf
        - nfs.conf

    - name: Enable and start NFS services
      systemd:
        name: "{{ item }}"
        enabled: yes
        state: started
      with_items:
        - nfs-server
        - nfs-mountd
        - nfs-idmapd
        - rpcbind

    - name: Permit traffic to rpcbind service (Archlinux/EndeavourOS)
      firewalld:
        service: rpc-bind
        permanent: yes
        state: enabled
        immediate: yes
      when: ansible_os_family == 'Archlinux'

    - name: Permit traffic to rpcbind service (MX/Debian)
      ufw:
        rule: allow
        port: "{{ item }}"
        proto: tcp
      loop:
        - 111
        - 2049
        - 20048
        - 20049
        - 20050
      when: ansible_distribution == 'MX' or ansible_distribution == 'Debian'

    - name: Ignore errors in check mode
      command: echo "Ignoring errors"
      ignore_errors: yes
      check_mode: yes

    - name: Ensure exported folders exist
      file:
        path: /srv/exports/{{ item.name }}
        state: directory
        owner: "{{ item.owner }}"
        group: "{{ item.group }}"
        mode: "{{ item.mode }}"
      with_items:
        - { name: "folder1", owner: "owner_name", group: "group_name", mode: "0755" }
        - { name: "folder2", owner: "owner_name", group: "group_name", mode: "0755" }

    - name: Add entries to /etc/fstab
      lineinfile:
        path: /etc/fstab
        line: "{{ item.line }}"
      with_items:
        - { line: "/srv/exports/folder1 /path/to/mount1 nfs defaults 0 0" }
        - { line: "/srv/exports/folder2 /path/to/mount2 nfs defaults 0 0" }

    - name: Reload systemd daemon
      systemd:
        daemon_reload: yes

    - name: Mount exported folders
      mount:
        path: "/path/to/mount{{ item }}"
        src: "server_ip:/srv/exports/folder{{ item }}"
        fstype: nfs
        opts: defaults
        state: mounted
      with_sequence: start=1 end=2

    - name: Set exports in /etc/exports
      template:
        src: etc/exports.j2
        dest: /etc/exports

    - name: Reload exports
      command: exportfs -r

---

- name: Install musikcube systemd
  template:
    src: etc/systemd/system/musikcube.service
    dest: /etc/systemd/system/musikcube.service
    mode: '0644'

- name: Enable musikcube services
  systemd:
    name: musikcubed
    enabled: yes
    state: started
    daemon_reload: yes

---

- name: Install rsyncd config
  template:
    src: etc/rsyncd.conf.j2
    dest: /etc/rsyncd.conf
    mode: '0644'
  register: rsyncd_config

- name: Ensure rsyncd service is running
  service:
    name: rsyncd
    state: restarted
    enabled: yes
  when: rsyncd_config.changed

---
- name: NAS Tasks
  debug:
    msg: "Starting NAS tasks"

- import_tasks:
    file: nfs.yml
  tags: ['nfs']

- import_tasks:
    file: samba.yml
  when: samba_host|bool
  tags: ['samba']

# - import_tasks:
#     file: rsyncd.yml
#   when: rsyncd_host|bool
#   tags: ['rsyncd']
#
# - import_tasks:
#     file: musikcube.yml
#   when: musikcube_host|bool
#   tags: ['musikcube']

---
# vars file for nfs

---
# defaults file for nas

firewall:
  nfs:
    ports:
      lockd:
        tcp: 32803
        udp: 32769
      mountd: 892
      statd: 662
      rpc: 40418

samba_host: False

bind_share_exports: False

---

- name: restart nginx
  debug: msg="checking config first"
  changed_when: True
  notify:
    - check nginx configuration
    - restart nginx - after config check

- name: reload nginx
  debug: msg="checking config first"
  changed_when: True
  notify:
    - check nginx configuration
    - reload nginx - after config check

- name: check nginx configuration
  shell: "{{ nginx_binary_name }} -t"
  register: result
  changed_when: "result.rc != 0"
  when: nginx_installation_type in nginx_installation_types_using_service

- name: restart nginx - after config check
  service: name={{ nginx_service_name }} state=restarted
  when: nginx_installation_type in nginx_installation_types_using_service and nginx_daemon_mode == "on"

- name: reload nginx - after config check
  service: name={{ nginx_service_name }} state=reloaded
  when: nginx_installation_type in nginx_installation_types_using_service and nginx_daemon_mode == "on"

- name: restart rsyslog
  service: name=rsyslog state=restarted

---

- name: Create the directories for site specific configurations
  file:
    path: "{{ nginx_conf_dir }}/{{ item }}"
    state: directory
    owner: root
    group: nginx
    mode: '0755'
    recurse: False
  with_items:
    - "sites-available"
    - "sites-enabled"
    - "auth_basic"
    - "conf.d"
    - "conf.d/stream"
  tags: [configuration,nginx]

- name: Ensure log directory exist
  file:
    path: "{{ nginx_log_dir }}"
    state: directory
    owner: nginx
    group: nginx
    recurse: false
  tags: [configuration,nginx]

---
- name: Copy the nginx configuration file
  template: src=nginx.conf.j2 dest={{nginx_conf_dir}}/nginx.conf
  notify:
   - restart nginx
  tags: [nginx_conf,nginx]

- name: Ensure auth_basic files created
  template: src=auth_basic.j2 dest={{nginx_conf_dir}}/auth_basic/{{ item }} owner=root group={{nginx_group}} mode=0750
  with_items: "{{ nginx_auth_basic_files.keys() }}"
  tags: [nginx_conf,nginx]

- name: Create the configurations for sites
  template: src=site.conf.j2 dest={{nginx_conf_dir}}/sites-available/{{ item }}.conf
  with_items: "{{ nginx_sites.keys() | difference(nginx_remove_sites) }}"
  notify:
   - reload nginx
  tags: [nginx_vhost,nginx]

- name: Create links for sites-enabled
  file: state=link src={{nginx_conf_dir}}/sites-available/{{ item }}.conf dest={{nginx_conf_dir}}/sites-enabled/{{ item }}.conf
  with_items: "{{ nginx_sites.keys() | difference(nginx_remove_sites) }}"
  notify:
   - reload nginx
  tags: [nginx_vhost,nginx]

- name: Create the configurations for independent config file
  template: src=config.conf.j2 dest={{nginx_conf_dir}}/conf.d/{{ item }}.conf
  with_items: "{{ nginx_configs.keys() }}"
  notify:
   - reload nginx
  tags: [nginx_conf,nginx]

- name: Create the configurations for independent config file for streams
  template: src=config_stream.conf.j2 dest={{nginx_conf_dir}}/conf.d/stream/{{ item }}.conf
  with_items: "{{ nginx_stream_configs.keys() }}"
  notify:
   - reload nginx
  tags: [nginx_conf,nginx]
  when: nginx_official_repo_mainline

---
- name: Find enabled sites
  shell: ls -1 {{nginx_conf_dir}}/sites-enabled || true
  register: enabled_sites
  changed_when: False
  tags: [configuration,nginx]

- name: Disable unmanaged sites
  file: path={{nginx_conf_dir}}/sites-enabled/{{ item }} state=absent
  with_items: "{{ enabled_sites.stdout.split() }}"
  # 'item.conf' => 'item'
  when: item[:-5] not in nginx_sites.keys()
  notify:
   - reload nginx
  tags: [configuration,nginx]

- name: Find config files
  shell: ls -1 {{nginx_conf_dir}}/conf.d
  register: config_files
  changed_when: False
  tags: [configuration,nginx]

- name: Remove unmanaged config files
  file: name={{nginx_conf_dir}}/conf.d/{{ item }} state=absent
  with_items: "{{ config_files.stdout.split() }}"
  # 'item.conf' => 'item'
  when: item[:-5] not in nginx_configs.keys()
  notify:
   - reload nginx
  tags: [configuration,nginx]

---
#TODO: find out why you would pass RUNLEVEL=1 to perform this task....
- name: Ensure RPM official nginx key
  rpm_key: key=http://nginx.org/keys/nginx_signing.key
  environment: "{{ nginx_env }}"
  when: ansible_distribution == 'RedHat'

- name: Ensure YUM official nginx repository
  template: src=nginx.repo.j2 dest=/etc/yum.repos.d/nginx.repo
  when: ansible_distribution == 'RedHat'

---

- name: install nginx dependencies
  dnf:
    name: "{{ item }}"
    state: present
    update_cache: yes
  with_items:
    - git
    - "@Development Tools"
    - pcre2-devel
    - pcre-devel
  when: ansible_distribution == 'Fedora'

- name: install nginx dependencies
  pacman:
    name: "{{ item }}"
    state: present
    force: yes
    extra_args: --noconfirm
  with_items:
    - base-devel
    - git
    - pcre
    - pcre2
  when: ansible_os_family == 'Archlinux'

- name: create nginx group
  group:
    name: nginx
    state: present
    system: True

- name: create nginx user
  user:
    name: nginx
    state: present
    group: nginx
    system: True

- name: fetch nginx source
  get_url:
    url: http://nginx.org/download/nginx-1.22.1.tar.gz
    dest: "/tmp"
    validate_certs: no

- name: extract nginx source
  unarchive:
    src: /tmp/nginx-1.22.1.tar.gz
    dest: "/tmp"
    remote_src: yes

- name: clone fancyindex
  git:
    repo: "https://github.com/aperezdc/ngx-fancyindex.git"
    dest: "/tmp/ngx-fancyindex"
    accept_hostkey: yes
    update: no
    force: no
    recursive: yes

- name: configure nginx with modules
  shell: |
    ./configure --prefix=/usr --http-log-path=/var/log/nginx/access.log --error-log-path=/var/log/nginx/error.log --pid-path=/run/nginx.pid --conf-path=/etc/nginx/nginx.conf --modules-path=/usr/share/nginx/modules --add-module=../ngx-fancyindex --with-http_addition_module --with-http_mp4_module --with-http_gunzip_module --with-http_gzip_static_module --with-http_ssl_module
  args:
    chdir: /tmp/nginx-1.22.1

- name: make and install nginx
  shell: |
      make && make install
  args:
    chdir: /tmp/nginx-1.22.1

---
- name: Install the selinux python module
  yum: name=python3-libselinux state=present
  when: ansible_distribution == "RedHat"
  tags: [packages,nginx]

# this really isn't needed here as we install epel using the common role
# will comment out for now
# - name: Install the epel packages
#   yum: name=epel-release state=present
#   when: nginx_is_el|bool
#   tags: [packages,nginx]

- name: Install the nginx packages from either epel or nginx_offical repo
  yum: >
    name={{ item }}
    state=latest
    enablerepo={{ "nginx" if nginx_official_repo else "" }}
  with_items: "{{ nginx_redhat_pkg }}"
  when:  nginx_is_el|bool and not nginx_passenger
  tags: [packages,nginx]

  ###update 5/4 - changed to state=present as using latest lead to an
  #unexpected update to nginx
  # use state=latest in case nginx was already installed from epel.
  # this will ensure the passenger complied version of nginx is installed
- name: Install nginx & passenger packages using passenger repo
  yum: >
    name={{ item }}
    state=present
    enablerepo={{ yum_passenger_repo }}
  with_items: "{{ nginx_passenger_redhat_pkg }}"
  when: nginx_is_el|bool and nginx_passenger
  tags: [packages,nginx]

- name: Install the nginx packages for a rhel based distro that isn't Redhat or Centos
  yum: name={{ item }} state=present
  with_items: "{{ nginx_redhat_pkg }}"
  when: ansible_distribution == "RedHat" and not nginx_is_el|bool
  tags: [packages,nginx]

---
  - name: Ensure OpenSSL is installed
    yum: name=openssl state=present
    when: ansible_distribution == "RedHat"
    tags: [ssl-certs,packages]

  - name: Ensure ssl folder exist
    file:
      path: "{{ ssl_certs_path }}"
      state: directory
      owner: "{{ ssl_certs_path_owner }}"
      group: "{{ ssl_certs_path_group }}"
      mode: "{{ ssl_certs_mode }}"
    tags: [ssl-certs,configuration]

  - local_action: stat path={{ ssl_certs_local_privkey_path }}
    register: stat_privkey
    become: no
    tags: [ssl-certs,configuration]

  - local_action: stat path={{ ssl_certs_local_cert_path }}
    register: stat_cert
    become: no
    tags: [ssl-certs,configuration]

  - name: Test if privkey file is needed
    fail: msg="Privkey file {{ ssl_certs_local_privkey_path }} is missing"
    when: not stat_privkey.stat.exists and stat_cert.stat.exists
    tags: [ssl-certs,configuration]

  - name: Test if cert file is needed
    fail: msg="Cert file {{ ssl_certs_local_cert_path }} is missing"
    when: stat_privkey.stat.exists and not stat_cert.stat.exists
    tags: [ssl-certs,configuration]

  - include_tasks: generate.yml
    when: >
      ( not stat_privkey.stat.exists and not stat_cert.stat.exists )
      and ( ssl_certs_local_privkey_data is undefined and ssl_certs_local_cert_data is undefined )
    tags: [ssl-certs,configuration]

  - name: Copy SSL certificates
    copy:
      src: "{{ item.src }}"
      dest: "{{ item.dest }}"
      owner: "{{ ssl_certs_path_owner }}"
      group: "{{ ssl_certs_path_group }}"
      mode: "{{ ssl_certs_mode }}"
    when: >
      ( stat_privkey.stat.exists and stat_cert.stat.exists )
      and ( ssl_certs_local_privkey_data is undefined and ssl_certs_local_cert_data is undefined )
    with_items:
      - { src: "{{ ssl_certs_local_cert_path }}", dest: "{{ ssl_certs_cert_path }}" }
      - { src: "{{ ssl_certs_local_privkey_path }}", dest: "{{ ssl_certs_privkey_path }}" }
    tags: [ssl-certs,configuration]

  - name: Copy SSL certificate data
    copy:
      content: "{{ item.content }}"
      dest: "{{ item.dest }}"
      owner: "{{ ssl_certs_path_owner }}"
      group: "{{ ssl_certs_path_group }}"
      mode: "{{ ssl_certs_mode }}"
    when: ssl_certs_local_privkey_data is defined and ssl_certs_local_cert_data is defined
    with_items:
      - { content: "{{ ssl_certs_local_cert_data|default }}", dest: "{{ ssl_certs_cert_path }}" }
      - { content: "{{ ssl_certs_local_privkey_data|default }}", dest: "{{ ssl_certs_privkey_path }}" }
    no_log: true
    tags: [ssl-certs,configuration]

  - name: Generate strong DHE parameter - https://weakdh.org/
    command: openssl dhparam -out {{ssl_certs_dhparam_path}} {{ssl_certs_dhparam_size}} creates={{ssl_certs_dhparam_path}}
    when: ssl_certs_generate_dh_param
    tags: [ssl-certs,configuration]

---

- name: install nginx dependencies
  dnf:
    name: "{{ item }}"
    state: present
    update_cache: yes
  with_items:
    - git
    - "@Development Tools"
    - pcre2-devel
    - pcre-devel
  when: ansible_distribution == 'Fedora'

- name: install nginx dependencies
  pacman:
    name: "{{ item }}"
    state: present
    force: yes
    extra_args: --noconfirm
  with_items:
    - base-devel
    - git
    - pcre
    - pcre2
  when: ansible_os_family == 'Archlinux'

- name: fetch nginx source
  get_url:
    url: http://nginx.org/download/nginx-1.22.1.tar.gz
    dest: "/tmp"
    validate_certs: no

- name: extract nginx source
  unarchive:
    src: /tmp/nginx-1.22.1.tar.gz
    dest: "/tmp"
    remote_src: yes

- name: clone fancyindex
  git:
    repo: "https://github.com/aperezdc/ngx-fancyindex.git"
    dest: "/tmp/ngx-fancyindex"
    accept_hostkey: yes
    update: no
    force: no
    recursive: yes

- name: configure nginx with modules
  shell: |
    ./configure --prefix=/usr --http-log-path=/var/log/nginx/access.log --error-log-path=/var/log/nginx/error.log --pid-path=/run/nginx.pid --conf-path=/etc/nginx/nginx.conf --modules-path=/usr/share/nginx/modules --add-module=../ngx-fancyindex --with-http_addition_module --with-http_mp4_module --without-http_autoindex_module --without-http_gzip_module
  args:
    chdir: /tmp/nginx-1.22.1

- name: make and install nginx
  shell: |
      make && make install
  args:
    chdir: /tmp/nginx-1.22.1

---

- block:
    - name: Allow nginx to read files in syncopated webroot
      sefcontext:
        target: '/usr/share/nginx/html/syncopated(/.*)?'
        setype: httpd_sys_content_t
        state: present

    - name: Apply new SELinux file context to filesystem
      command: restorecon -iRv /usr/share/nginx/html/syncopated/

  become: True
  notify: restart nginx

---
- name: Ensure RPM passenger-phusion key
  rpm_key: key=https://packagecloud.io/gpg.key validate_certs=yes
  when: ansible_distribution == 'RedHat'
  tags: [configuration,nginx]

- name: Ensure passenger yum repo file exists
  template: src=nginx.repo.j2 dest=/etc/yum.repos.d/passenger.repo
  when: ansible_distribution == 'RedHat'
  tags: [configuration,nginx]

- name: force yum to import gpgkey
  shell: yum -qy repolist
  tags: [configuration,nginx]

---
- name: Remove unwanted sites
  file: path={{nginx_conf_dir}}/{{ item[0] }}/{{ item[1] }}.conf state=absent
  with_nested:
    - [ 'sites-enabled', 'sites-available']
    - "{{ nginx_remove_sites }}"
  notify:
   - reload nginx
  tags: [configuration,nginx]

- name: Remove unwanted conf
  file: path={{nginx_conf_dir}}/conf.d/{{ item[1] }}.conf state=absent
  with_items: "{{ nginx_remove_configs }}"
  notify:
   - reload nginx
  tags: [configuration,nginx]

- name: Remove unwanted auth_basic_files
  file: path={{nginx_conf_dir}}/auth_basic/{{ item[1] }} state=absent
  with_items: "{{ nginx_remove_auth_basic_files }}"
  notify:
   - reload nginx
  tags: [configuration,nginx]

---
- name: Disable the default site
  file: path={{nginx_conf_dir}}/sites-enabled/default state=absent
  notify:
  - reload nginx
  tags: [configuration,nginx]

- name: Remove the default configuration
  file: path={{nginx_conf_dir}}/conf.d/default.conf state=absent
  when: nginx_remove_default_configs
  # when: >
  #   'default' not in nginx_configs.keys()
  notify:
  - reload nginx
  tags: [configuration,nginx]

---

- include_tasks: tasks/ssl.yml
  when: use_ssl is defined
  tags: ['ssl']

- name: copy rsyslog config for nginx
  copy: >
    src=90-nginx_rsyslog.conf
    dest=/etc/rsyslog.d/90-nginx_rsyslog.conf
    owner=root
    group=root
    mode=0644
  notify: restart rsyslog
  tags: [configuration,nginx]

- import_tasks:
    file: nginx-official-repo.yml
  when: nginx_official_repo == True

- import_tasks:
    file: passenger-phusion-repo.yml
  when: nginx_passenger == True

- import_tasks:
    file: installation.packages.yml
  when: nginx_installation_type == "packages"

- import_tasks:
    file: installation.source.yml
  when: nginx_installation_type == "source"

- import_tasks:
    file: ensure-dirs.yml

- import_tasks:
    file: remove-defaults.yml
  when: not keep_only_specified

- import_tasks:
    file: remove-extras.yml
  when: keep_only_specified

- import_tasks:
    file: remove-unwanted.yml

- import_tasks:
    file: configuration.yml

- name: Create /usr/share/nginx/html
  file:
    path: /usr/share/nginx/html
    state: directory
    owner: root
    group: root
    recurse: True

- name: create blank index.html for default traffic
  copy: >
    src=index.html
    dest=/usr/share/nginx/html/index.html
    backup=yes
    owner=root
    group=root
    mode=0644
  when: nginx_create_blank_index

- import_tasks:
    file: selinux.yml

- name: Start the nginx service
  service: name={{ nginx_service_name }} state=started enabled=yes
  when: nginx_installation_type in nginx_installation_types_using_service and nginx_daemon_mode == "on"
  tags: [service,nginx]

---
nginx_redhat_pkg:
  - nginx

nginx_ubuntu_pkg:
  - python-selinux
  - nginx

nginx_freebsd_pkg:
  - nginx

nginx_suse_pkg:
  - nginx

nginx_env:
 RUNLEVEL: 1

nginx_installation_types_using_service: ["packages", "configuration-only"]

nginx_is_el: "{{ distribution in ['RedHat', 'CentOS'] }}"

yum_epel_repo: epel
yum_base_repo: base
yum_passenger_repo: passenger

nginx_official_repo: False
nginx_official_repo_mainline: False

nginx_passenger: False
nginx_passenger_redhat_pkg:
  - curl
  - pygpgme
  - nginx
  - passenger
  - passenger-devel


keep_only_specified: False


nginx_installation_type: "packages"
nginx_binary_name: "nginx"
nginx_service_name: "{{nginx_binary_name}}"
nginx_conf_dir: "{% if ansible_distribution == 'FreeBSD' %}/usr/local/etc/nginx{% else %}/etc/nginx{% endif %}"

nginx_user: "{% if ansible_distribution == 'RedHat' or ansible_distribution == 'Fedora' %}nginx{% elif ansible_distribution == 'Debian' %}www-data{% elif ansible_distribution == 'FreeBSD' %}www{% endif %}"
nginx_group: "{{nginx_user}}"

nginx_pid_file: '/var/run/{{nginx_service_name}}.pid'

nginx_worker_processes: "{% if ansible_processor_vcpus is defined %}{{ ansible_processor_vcpus }}{% else %}auto{% endif %}"
nginx_worker_rlimit_nofile: 1024
nginx_log_dir: "/var/log/nginx"

nginx_events_params:
  - worker_connections {% if nginx_max_clients is defined %}{{nginx_max_clients}}{% else %}512{% endif %}

nginx_http_params:
  - sendfile "on";
  - tcp_nopush "on";
  - tcp_nodelay "on";
  - keepalive_timeout "70";
  - log_format  graylog2_format  '$remote_addr - $remote_user [$time_local] "$request" $status $body_bytes_sent "$http_referer" "$http_user_agent" "$http_x_forwarded_for" <msec=$msec|connection=$connection|connection_requests=$connection_requests|millis=$request_time>';
  - access_log {{nginx_log_dir}}/access.log graylog2_format;
  - error_log "{{nginx_log_dir}}/error.log";
  - server_tokens off;
  - types_hash_max_size 2048;
  - fastcgi_buffers 256 4k;
  - map_hash_bucket_size 128;
  - map $sent_http_content_type $expires { default off; text/html epoch; text/css max; application/javascript max; ~image/ max; }

nginx_stream_params: []

nginx_sites:
  00_default:
    - listen 80 default_server
    - server_name _
    - root "{% if ansible_distribution == 'FreeBSD' %}/usr/local/www/nginx-dist{% else %}/usr/share/nginx/html{% endif %}"
    - index index.html
    - autoindex on
nginx_remove_sites: []

nginx_configs:
  proxy:
    - proxy_http_version 1.1
    - proxy_set_header Upgrade $http_upgrade
    - proxy_set_header Connection upgrade
    - proxy_set_header Host $http_host
    - proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Proto $scheme
    - proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $remote_addr
    - proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Port $server_port
    - proxy_set_header X-Request-Start $msec
  gzip:
    - gzip on
    - gzip_min_length  1100
    - gzip_buffers  4 32k
    - gzip_types    text/css text/javascript text/xml text/plain text/x-component application/javascript application/x-javascript application/json application/xml  application/rss+xml font/truetype application/x-font-ttf font/opentype application/vnd.ms-fontobject image/svg+xml image/png image/gif image/jpeg
    - gzip_vary on
    - gzip_http_version 1.1
    - gzip_comp_level  9
    - gzip_disable "MSIE [1-6]\.(?!.*SV1)"

nginx_stream_configs: {}

nginx_remove_default_configs: False

nginx_remove_configs: []

nginx_auth_basic_files: {}
nginx_remove_auth_basic_files: []

nginx_daemon_mode: "on"

nginx_create_blank_index: True



ssl_certs_country: "US"
ssl_certs_locality: "Chicago"
ssl_certs_organization: "some org"
ssl_certs_state: "Illinois"
ssl_certs_common_name: "someorg.net"
ssl_certs_days: "3650"
ssl_certs_fields: "/C={{ssl_certs_country}}/ST={{ssl_certs_state}}/L={{ssl_certs_locality}}/O={{ssl_certs_organization}}/CN={{ssl_certs_common_name}}"

ssl_certs_path: "/etc/ssl/certs/{{ssl_certs_common_name}}"
ssl_certs_path_owner: "root"
ssl_certs_path_group: "root"
ssl_certs_privkey_path: "{{ssl_certs_path}}/{{ssl_certs_common_name}}.key"
ssl_certs_cert_path: "{{ssl_certs_path}}/{{ssl_certs_common_name}}.crt"
ssl_certs_csr_path: "{{ssl_certs_path}}/{{ssl_certs_common_name}}.csr"
ssl_certs_dhparam_path: "{{ssl_certs_path}}/dhparam.pem"
ssl_certs_mode: 0644

ssl_certs_local_privkey_path: "/etc/pki/ssl/{{ssl_certs_common_name}}.key"
ssl_certs_local_cert_path: "/etc/pki/ssl/{{ssl_certs_common_name}}.crt"

ssl_certs_generate_self_signed: false
ssl_certs_key_size: "2048"
ssl_certs_generate_dh_param: false
ssl_certs_dhparam_size: "2048"

galaxy_info:
  author: your name
  description: your role description
  company: your company (optional)

  # If the issue tracker for your role is not on github, uncomment the
  # next line and provide a value
  # issue_tracker_url: http://example.com/issue/tracker

  # Choose a valid license ID from https://spdx.org - some suggested licenses:

  # - MIT
  # - GPL-2.0-or-later

  # - Apache-2.0
  # - CC-BY-4.0
  license: license (GPL-2.0-or-later, MIT, etc)

  min_ansible_version: 2.1

  # If this a Container Enabled role, provide the minimum Ansible Container version.
  # min_ansible_container_version:

  galaxy_tags: []
    # List tags for your role here, one per line. A tag is a keyword that describes

dependencies: []

---
# handlers file for terminal

---
- hosts: localhost
  remote_user: root
  roles:
    - terminal

---

- name: Install terminal packages
  aur:
    use: paru
    name: "{{ terminal__packages }}"
    state: present
    extra_args: "--overwrite '*'"
  become: False
  when: ansible_os_family == "Archlinux"

---
# tasks file for terminal

- import_tasks:
    file: packages.yml
  tags: ['packages']

- name: Ensure terminal directories exist
  file:
    dest: "{{ terminal_directory_default_location }}/{{ item.dest }}"
    state: directory
    owner: "{{ item.owner | default(omit) }}"
    group: "{{ item.group | default(omit) }}"
    mode: "{{ item.mode | default(omit) }}"
    recurse: "{{ item.recurse | default(false) }}"
  loop: "{{ terminal_directory_definitions }}"
  check_mode: no

- name: Install kitty templates
  template:
    src: "kitty/{{ item }}.j2"
    dest: "{{ user.home }}/.config/kitty/{{ item }}"
    owner: "{{ user.name }}"
    group: "{{ user.group }}"
    mode: '0644'
    backup: True
  with_items:
    - kitty.conf
    - current-theme.conf
    - open-actions.conf
    - start.conf
  tags: ['kitty']

- name: Set tilda config
  template:
    src: tilda/config_0.j2
    dest: "{{ user.home }}/.config/tilda/config_0"
    owner: "{{ user.name }}"
    group: "{{ user.group }}"
    mode: '0644'
  tags: ['tilda']

- block:
  - name: Install guake-utils
    copy:
      src: guake-utils
      dest: /usr/local/bin/guake-utils
      mode: '0755'

  - name: Install guake settings
    copy:
      src: .guake/guake-settings
      dest: "{{ user.home }}/.guake/guake-settings"
      owner: "{{ user.name }}"
      group: "{{ user.group }}"
      mode: '0644'
    register: guakesettings

  - name: Import guake-settings
    shell: /usr/local/bin/guake-utils import
    when: guakesettings.changed
    become: False

  tags: ['guake']

---
# vars file for terminal

---
# defaults file for terminal

# The default directory permission mode when creating directories using `terminal_directory_definitions`
terminal_directory_default_mode: '0750'

# The default directory owner when creating directories using `terminal_directory_definitions`
terminal_directory_default_owner: "{{ user.name }}"

# The default directory group when creating directories using `terminal_directory_definitions`
terminal_directory_default_group: "{{ user.name }}"

terminal_directory_default_location: "{{ user.home }}"

terminal_directory_default_recurse: False

terminal_directory_definitions:
  - dest: ".config/alacritty"
  - dest: ".config/terminator"
  - dest: ".config/kitty"
  - dest: ".config/tilda"
  - dest: ".guake"

terminal__packages:
  - blackbox-terminal
  - guake
  - kitty-shell-integration
  - kitty-terminfo
  - termdown
  - terminator
  - termpdf.py-git
  - tilda

galaxy_info:
  author: your name
  description: your role description
  company: your company (optional)

  # If the issue tracker for your role is not on github, uncomment the
  # next line and provide a value
  # issue_tracker_url: http://example.com/issue/tracker

  # Choose a valid license ID from https://spdx.org - some suggested licenses:
  # - BSD-3-Clause (default)

  # - GPL-3.0-only
  # - Apache-2.0

  license: license (GPL-2.0-or-later, MIT, etc)

  # If this a Container Enabled role, provide the minimum Ansible Container version.

---
# handlers file for libvirt

---
- hosts: localhost
  remote_user: root
  roles:
    - libvirt

---

- block:

    - name: Add Hasicorp repository
      shell: yum-config-manager --add-repo https://rpm.releases.hashicorp.com/RHEL/hashicorp.repo

    - name: Install vagrant requirements
      dnf:
        name: "{{ item }}"
        state: present
        update_cache: yes
      loop:
        - '@Development Tools'
        - cmake
        - libguestfs-tools-c
        - libvirt-devel
        - libxml2-devel
        - libxslt-devel
        - rsync
        - ruby
        - ruby-devel
        - zlib-devel

    - name: Install vagrant
      dnf:
        name: vagrant
        state: present
        update_cache: yes

  when: ansible_distribution == 'Fedora'
  tags: ['packages']

- block:

    - name: Install vagrant
      pacman:
        name: vagrant
        state: present
        force: yes
        extra_args: --noconfirm

  when: ansible_os_family == 'Archlinux'
  tags: ['packages']

---
# tasks file for libvirt

- name: Libvirt Tasks
  debug:
    msg: "Starting libvirt tasks"

- block:
    # :: exfatprogs and exfat-utils are in conflict. Remove exfat-utils? [y/N]
    - name: Remove conflicting packages
      pacman:
        name: exfat-utils
        state: absent
        force: yes
        extra_args: --noconfirm

    - name: Install libvirt packages
      pacman:
        name: "{{ item }}"
        state: present
        force: yes
        extra_args: --noconfirm --overwrite '*'
      loop:
        - dmidecode
        - dnsmasq
        - edk2-ovmf
        - libguestfs
        - libvirt
        - qemu-full
        - virt-install
        - virt-manager
        - virt-viewer

  when: ansible_os_family == 'Archlinux'
  tags: ['packages']

- name: Set socket group and perms to allow for remote access
  copy:
    src: etc/libvirt/libvirtd.conf
    dest: /etc/libvirt/libvirtd.conf
    mode: '0644'

- name: Disable lvmetad for remote access reasons
  lineinfile:
    dest: /etc/lvm/lvm.conf
    regexp: "^    use_lvmetad = 1"
    line: "    use_lvmetad = 0"
    backrefs: yes
    backup: yes

- name: Add user to libvirt group
  user:
    name: "{{ user.name }}"
    groups: "libvirt,kvm"
    append: yes
  ignore_errors: "{{ ansible_check_mode }}"

- name: set libvirtd service preset
  systemd:
    name: libvirtd
    enabled: True
  when: libvirt.service == 'enabled'

- import_tasks:
    file: vagrant.yml
  when: use_vagrant|default(false)|bool == True
  tags: ['vagrant']

---
# vars file for libvirt

---
# defaults file for libvirt

libvirt:
  service: 'disabled'

use_libvirt: False

---

- name: Install osc2midi
  package:
    name: osc2midi
    state: present

- name: Set osc2midi config
  copy:
    src: usr/share/osc2midi/touchosc/Beatmachine.omm
    dest: /usr/share/osc2midi/touchosc/Beatmachine.omm
    mode: '0644'
    backup: yes

---

- name: Check if Protokol is already installed
  stat:
    path: "/usr/local/bin/Protokol_{{ protokol.version }}"
  register: protokol_installed
  changed_when: false

- name: Check if update_Protokol variable is defined
  set_fact:
    protokol_update_required: "{{ update_Protokol is defined }}"
  changed_when: false

- block:
    - name: Remove existing Protokol version
      file:
        path: "/usr/local/bin/Protokol_{{ protokol.version }}"
        state: absent
      when: protokol_update_required

    - name: Fetch Protokol
      get_url:
        url: "{{ protokol.url }}/{{ protokol.file }}"
        dest: "/tmp"

    - name: Extract and install Protokol
      shell:
        cmd: |
          unzip -q -o "/tmp/{{ protokol.file }}" -d "/tmp"
          mv "/tmp/Protokol" "/usr/local/bin/Protokol_{{ protokol.version }}"
          chmod +x /usr/local/bin/Protokol_{{ protokol.version }}
      args:
        creates: "/usr/local/bin/Protokol_{{ protokol.version }}"
        executable: /bin/bash

    - name: Create new symlink
      file:
        src: "/usr/local/bin/Protokol"
        dest: "/usr/local/bin/Protokol_{{ protokol.version }}"
        state: link
        force: yes

    - name: Install desktop entry
      copy:
        src: usr/share/applications/Protokol.desktop
        dest: /usr/share/applications/Protokol.desktop
        mode: '644'

  when: not protokol_installed.stat.exists or protokol_update_required

---

- name: Check if TouchOSC is already installed
  stat:
    path: "/usr/local/bin/TouchOSC_{{ touchosc.version }}"
  register: touchosc_installed
  changed_when: false

- name: Check if update_TouchOSC variable is defined
  set_fact:
    touchosc_update_required: "{{ update_TouchOSC is defined }}"
  changed_when: false

- block:
    - name: Remove existing TouchOSC version
      file:
        path: "/usr/local/bin/TouchOSC_{{ touchosc.version }}"
        state: absent
      when: touchosc_installed.stat.exists and touchosc_update_required

    - name: Fetch TouchOSC
      get_url:
        url: "{{ touchosc.url }}/{{ touchosc.file }}"
        dest: "/tmp"

    - name: Extract and install TouchOSC
      shell:
        cmd: |
          unzip -q -o "/tmp/{{ touchosc.file }}" -d "/tmp"
          mv "/tmp/TouchOSC" "/usr/local/bin/TouchOSC_{{ touchosc.version }}"
          chmod +x /usr/local/bin/TouchOSC_{{ touchosc.version }}
      args:
        creates: "/usr/local/bin/TouchOSC_{{ touchosc.version }}"
        executable: /bin/bash

    - name: create new symlink
      file:
        src: "/usr/local/bin/TouchOSC_{{ touchosc.version }}"
        dest: "/usr/local/bin/TouchOSC"
        state: link
        force: yes

    - name: Install desktop entry
      copy:
        src: usr/share/applications/TouchOSC.desktop
        dest: /usr/share/applications/TouchOSC.desktop
        mode: '644'

  when: not touchosc_installed.stat.exists or touchosc_update_required

- import_tasks:
    file: touchosc.yml
  tags: ['touchosc']

- import_tasks:
    file: protokol.yml
  tags: ['protokol']

- import_tasks:

- name: Enable avahi service
  systemd:
    name: avahi-daemon
    enabled: yes
    state: started



# existing_file.results: This refers to the result of the stat task,
# which gathers information about the existence of files/directories specified in the loop parameter.

# selectattr('stat.exists', 'defined'): This filter selects the items from existing_file.results
# where the stat.exists attribute is defined. In other words, it filters out any results that don't have the stat.exists attribute.

# selectattr('stat.islnk', 'defined'): This filter further narrows down the selected items from the previous step
# by filtering only those results where the stat.islnk attribute is defined.
# This ensures that only symlink entries are considered.

# list: This filter converts the filtered results into a list format.

# length > 0: This checks if the length of the resulting list is greater than zero,
# indicating that there are existing symlink entries for the specified paths.

---

- name: Install backup_reaper.sh
  copy:
    src: home/.local/bin/backup_reaper.sh
    dest: "{{ user.home }}/.local/bin/backup_reaper.sh"
    owner: "{{ user.name }}"
    group: "{{ user.group }}"
    mode: '0755'
    backup: False

- name: Check if reaper is already installed
  stat:
    path: /usr/local/bin/reaper
  register: result
  ignore_errors: "{{ ansible_check_mode }}"

- block:
    - name: Check reaper version
      shell: |
        cat whatsnew.txt | grep {{ reaper.version }}
      args:
        chdir: /opt/REAPER
      register: if_installed_version
      changed_when: if_installed_version.stdout == ''
      failed_when: "'No such file or directory' in if_installed_version.msg and if_installed_version.rc != 0"

    - name: Debug msg
      debug:
        msg: "{{ if_installed_version }}"

    - name: Backup reaper home config
      shell: "{{ user.home }}/.local/bin/backup_reaper.sh"
      register: reaper_backup
      become_user: "{{ user.name }}"
      environment:
        PATH: "{{ ansible_env.PATH }}:/sbin:/bin:{{ path|join(':') }}"
      tags: ['backup']

    - name: Debug msg
      debug:
        msg: "{{ reaper_backup }}"

  when: result.stat.exists

- block:
    - name: Fetch reaper
      get_url:
        url: "{{ reaper.url }}{{ reaper.file }}"
        dest: "/tmp"
        # validate_certs: no

    - name: Uninstall reaper
      shell: |
        bash -x ./uninstall-reaper.sh --quiet --uninstall
      args:
        chdir: /opt/REAPER
      when: result.stat.exists

    - name: Extract and install reaper
      shell: |
        tar -xvf {{ reaper.file }}

        cd reaper_linux_x86_64/

        ./install-reaper.sh --install /opt \
                        --integrate-desktop \
                        --usr-local-bin-symlink
      args:
        chdir: "/tmp"

  when: (not result.stat.exists or if_installed_version.changed)

- name: Uninstall reaper only
  shell: |
    bash -x ./uninstall-reaper.sh --quiet --uninstall
  args:
    chdir: /opt/REAPER
  when: result.stat.exists and uninstall_reaper|default(false)|bool

---

- import_tasks:
    file: reaper.yml
  tags: ['reaper']

---

- name: Check if Sonic-Lineup is already installed
  stat:
    path: /usr/local/bin/sonic-lineup
  register: result
  ignore_errors: "{{ ansible_check_mode }}"

- block:
    - name: Fetch Sonic-Lineup
      get_url:
        url: "{{ url }}/{{ file }}"
        dest: "/tmp"
        validate_certs: no

    - name: Link Sonic-Lineup to bin
      shell: |
        chmod +x {{ file }}
        mv -v {{ file }} /usr/local/bin/
      args:
        chdir: "/tmp"

    - name: Create symlink
      file:
        src: "/usr/local/bin/SonicLineup-1.1-x86_64.AppImage"
        dest: "/usr/local/bin/sonic-lineup"
        state: link
        force: yes

  when: not result.stat.exists and not uninstall_soniclineup|default(false)|bool
  vars:
    url: "https://code.soundsoftware.ac.uk/attachments/download/2766"
    file: "SonicLineup-1.1-x86_64.AppImage"


- name: Uninstall Sonic-Lineup
  file:
    path: "/usr/local/bin/sonic-lineup"
    state: absent
    follow: yes
  when: result.stat.exists and uninstall_soniclineup|default(false)|bool

# when: not result.stat.exists and not uninstall_soniclineup|default(false)|bool
#
# If the software package is already installed (the result.stat.exists condition is true),
# the pipeline should not proceed with the installation.
# Additionally, if there is a request to uninstall "SonicLineup" (uninstall_soniclineup|default(false)|bool is true),
# the pipeline should not proceed with the installation, even if the package is not currently installed.

---

- name: Check if Sonic-Annotator is already installed
  stat:
    path: /usr/local/bin/sonic-annotator
  register: sonicannotator
  ignore_errors: "{{ ansible_check_mode }}"

- block:
    - name: Fetch Sonic-Annotator
      get_url:
        url: "{{ url }}/{{ file }}"
        dest: "/tmp"
        validate_certs: no

    - name: Extract Sonic-Annotator
      shell: |
        tar -xvf {{ file }}

        cd sonic-annotator-1.6-linux64-static/

        chmod +x sonic-annotator

        mv sonic-annotator /usr/local/bin/sonic-annotator
      args:
        chdir: "/tmp"

  when: not sonicannotator.stat.exists
  vars:
    url: "https://code.soundsoftware.ac.uk/attachments/download/2708"
    file: "sonic-annotator-1.6-linux64-static.tar.gz"

- name: Uninstall Sonic-Annotator
  file:
    path: "/usr/local/bin/sonic-annotator"
    state: absent
  when: sonicannotator.stat.exists and uninstall_sonicannotator|default(false)|bool

- name: Check if Tony is already installed
  stat:
    path: /usr/local/bin/tony
  register: result
  ignore_errors: "{{ ansible_check_mode }}"

- name: Install libxcrypt-compat
  pacman:
    name: libxcrypt-compat
    state: present
    force: yes
    extra_args: --noconfirm
  tags: ['packages']

- block:
    - name: Fetch Tony
      get_url:
        url: "{{ tony.url }}/Tony-2.1.1-x86_64.AppImage"
        dest: "/tmp"
        validate_certs: no

    - name: Link Tony AppImage to bin
      shell: |
        chmod +x Tony-2.1.1-x86_64.AppImage
        mv Tony-2.1.1-x86_64.AppImage /usr/local/bin/
      args:
        chdir: "/tmp"

    - name: Create symlink
      file:
        src: "/usr/local/bin/Tony-2.1.1-x86_64.AppImage"
        dest: "/usr/local/bin/tony"
        state: link
        force: yes

  when: not result.stat.exists and not uninstall_tony|default(false)|bool

- name: Uninstall Tony
  file:
    path: "/usr/local/bin/tony"
    state: absent
    follow: yes
  when: result.stat.exists and uninstall_tony|default(false)|bool

---

- name: Check if the vamp plugins currently exist
  stat:
    path: "/usr/local/share/vamp/vamp-example-plugins.so"
  register: vamp_installed
  ignore_errors: "{{ ansible_check_mode }}"

- block:

    - name: Fetch vamp plugin installer
      get_url:
        url: "https://code.soundsoftware.ac.uk/attachments/download/2696/vamp-plugin-pack-installer-1.0"
        dest: /tmp
        mode: '0755'

    - name: Set user perms for /usr/local/share/vamp
      file:
        path: /usr/local/share/vamp
        state: directory
        owner: "{{ user.name }}"
        group: "{{ user.group }}"
        mode: '0755'

    - name: Run vamp plugin pack installer
      script: |
        /usr/bin/uxterm -class 'backup' -e /usr/bin/env DISPLAY=:0 /usr/bin/env VAMP_PATH="/usr/local/share/vamp" ./vamp-plugin-pack-installer-1.0
      args:
        chdir: /tmp
      run_once: True
      become: False
      ignore_errors: True


  when: not vamp_installed.stat.exists

  tags: ['soniclineup']

---
# fix for ERROR hiddev1: /usr/lib/udev/rules.d/69-mixxx-usb-uaccess.rules:57 Only network interfaces can be renamed, ignoring NAME="usb/%k".
- name: Comment out mixxx udev rule
  lineinfile:
    dest: /usr/lib/udev/rules.d/69-mixxx-usb-uaccess.rules
    regexp: "^KERNEL=="
    line: '#KERNEL=="hiddev*", NAME="usb/%k", GROUP="uaccess"'
    backrefs: yes
    backup: yes
  ignore_errors: "{{ ansible_check_mode }}"

---

- import_tasks:
    file: mixxx.yml
  tags: ['mixxx']

---

- name: DAW Tasks
  debug:
    msg: "Starting DAW role tasks"

- name: Set global variables
  set_fact:
    touchosc_installed: false
    touchosc_update_required: false
  tags: ['daw']

- name: Ensure application directories exist
  file:
    path: "{{ application_directory_default_location }}/{{ item.dest }}"
    state: directory
    owner: "{{ item.owner | default(omit) }}"
    group: "{{ item.group | default(omit) }}"
    mode: "{{ item.mode | default(omit) }}"
    recurse: "{{ item.recurse | default(false) }}"
  loop: "{{ application_directory_definitions }}"
  check_mode: no
  tags: ['profile']

- import_tasks:
    file: controllers/main.yml
  tags: ['controllers']

- import_tasks:
    file: analysis/main.yml
  tags: ['analysis']

- import_tasks:
    file: players/main.yml
  tags: ['players']

- import_tasks:
    file: editors/main.yml
  tags: ['editors']

# - import_tasks:

# The default directory permission mode when creating directories using `application_directory_definitions`
application_directory_default_mode: '0755'

# The default directory owner when creating directories using `application_directory_definitions`
application_directory_default_owner: "{{ user.name }}"

# The default directory group when creating directories using `application_directory_definitions`
application_directory_default_group: "{{ user.group }}"

application_directory_default_location: "{{ user.home }}"

application_directory_default_recurse: False

application_directory_definitions:
  - dest: ".sonic-pi/config"
  - dest: ".config/RaySession/session_templates/sound/XXX_SESSION_NAME_XXX.hydrogen"

  author: your name
  description: your role description
  company: your company (optional)

  # If the issue tracker for your role is not on github, uncomment the

  # - GPL-3.0-only
  # - Apache-2.0
  # - CC-BY-4.0
  license: license (GPL-2.0-or-later, MIT, etc)

  min_ansible_version: 2.1

  # If this a Container Enabled role, provide the minimum Ansible Container version.
  # min_ansible_container_version:

  # Provide a list of supported platforms, and for each platform a list of versions.

    #

dependencies: []

---
# handlers file for common
- name: Restart sshd
  service:
    name: sshd
    state: restarted
    enabled: True

---
- hosts: localhost
  remote_user: root
  roles:
    - common

---

- name: install base packages
  aur:
    use: auto
    name: "{{ base__packages }}"
    state: present
  become: False
  when: ansible_os_family == "Archlinux"
  tags: ['packages']

---

- name: Check -march support
  shell: |
    /lib/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2 --help | grep supported|xargs|awk '{print $1}'
  register: supported_march
  tags: ["always"]
  check_mode: False

- block:
    - name: Set architecture
      set_fact:
        architecture: "x86-64-v3"
      when: supported_march.stdout_lines[0] == 'x86-64-v3'

    - name: Set architecture
      set_fact:
        architecture: "x86-64"
      when: supported_march.stdout_lines[0] == 'x86-64-v2'

  when: supported_march.stdout_lines[0] is defined
  tags: ["always"]
  check_mode: False

---

#TODO: fix so that if the playbook run fails, handlers are still run for tasks that
# did complete successfully

- name: Set sshd config
  template:
    src: etc/ssh/sshd_config.j2
    dest: /etc/ssh/sshd_config
    backup: True
  # notify: Restart sshd
  register: sshdconfig

- name: Restart sshd
  service:
    name: sshd
    state: restarted
    enabled: True
  when: sshdconfig.changed

# - name: Adjust gnome-keyring-service file to include ssh and gpg
#   copy:
#     src: usr/lib/systemd/user/gnome-keyring-daemon.service
#     dest: /usr/lib/systemd/user/gnome-keyring-daemon.service
#     mode: '0644'
#     backup: yes
#   register: keyringservice
#   tags: ['gnome-keyring']

# - name: Disable gnome-keyring service
#   systemd:
#     name: gnome-keyring-daemon
#     enabled: yes
#     scope: user
#   become_user: "{{ user.name }}"
#   # when: keyringservice.changed
#   tags: ['gnome-keyring']

---

- name: Placeholder for /etc/environment
  copy:
    src: etc/environment
    dest: /etc/environment
    owner: root
    group: root
    mode: '0644'
    backup: yes

- name: Set /etc/profile
  template:
    src: etc/profile.j2
    dest: /etc/profile
    owner: root
    group: root
    mode: '0644'
    backup: yes

---

- name: Install ranger configs
  synchronize:
    src: home/ranger/
    dest: "{{ user.home }}/.config/ranger/"
    recursive: yes
    mode: push
    delete: no
    checksum: yes
    perms: no
    rsync_opts:
      - "--update"
      - "--omit-dir-times"
      - "--progress"
      - "--itemize-changes"
      - "--chown={{ user.name }}:{{ user.group }}"
  ignore_errors: "{{ ansible_check_mode }}"
  tags: ['ranger']

---

- name: Set autofs config folder
  set_fact:
    _autofs_dir: /etc
  when: ansible_distribution == 'Fedora' or ansible_distribution == 'Debian'

- name: Set autofs config folder
  set_fact:
    _autofs_dir: /etc/autofs
  when: ansible_os_family == 'Archlinux'

# - block:
#     - name: Install autofs
#       apt:
#         name: autofs
#         state: present
#       when: ansible_distribution == 'Debian'
#
#     - name: Install autofs
#       dnf:
#         name: autofs
#         state: present
#         update_cache: yes
#       when: ansible_distribution == 'Fedora'
#
#     - name: Install autofs
#       aur:
#         use: auto
#         name: autofs
#         state: present
#       become: False
#       when: ansible_os_family == 'Archlinux'
#
#   tags: ['packages']

- block:
    - name: Create mount directory folder if it doesn't already exist
      file:
        path: /mnt/{{ autofs_client.host }}
        state: directory
        mode: '0755'

    - name: Install autofs configs
      template:
        src: etc/autofs/{{ item }}.j2
        dest: "{{ _autofs_dir }}/{{ item }}"
        mode: '0644'
        backup: yes
      with_items:
        - autofs.conf
        - auto.master
        - auto.mnt
      register: autofsconfig

    - name: Enable autofs service
      systemd:
        name: autofs
        enabled: yes
      ignore_errors: "{{ ansible_check_mode }}"

---

- name: Create getty@tty1.service.d directory
  file:
    path: "/etc/systemd/system/getty@tty1.service.d"
    state: directory
    owner: root
    group: root

- name: Create systemd drop-in file for virtual console autologin
  template:
    src: "etc/systemd/system/getty@tty1.service.d/autologin.conf.j2"
    dest: "/etc/systemd/system/getty@tty1.service.d/autologin.conf"
    owner: root
    group: root
    mode: '0644'
    backup: yes

- name: "Get current systemd default"
  command: "systemctl get-default"
  changed_when: false
  register: systemdefault

- name: "Set default to graphical target"
  command: "systemctl set-default multi-user.target"
  when: "'multi-user' not in systemdefault.stdout"

---
#TODO: package this
# - name: Install modified starfield theme
#   unarchive:
#     src: files/usr/share/grub/starfield.tar.gz
#     dest: "/usr/share/grub/themes"
#   when: ansible_os_family == 'Archlinux'

- name: Check for EFI support
  shell: efibootmgr -v
  register: efi_check
  ignore_errors: yes
  tags: ['check']

- name: Set efi_supported variable
  set_fact:
    efi_supported: "{{ not efi_check.failed }}"
  tags: ['check']

- setup:
- debug:
    msg: "{{ efi_supported }}"
  tags: ['debug']

- name: Copy background to /usr/share/backgrounds
  copy:
    src: usr/share/backgrounds/str_01_04.png
    dest: /usr/share/backgrounds/str_01_04.png

- name: Set kernel cmdline params in grub
  template:
    src: etc/default/grub.j2
    dest: /etc/default/grub
    owner: root
    group: root
    mode: "644"
    backup: yes
  register: default_grub

- name: Remake grub if changes were made
  ansible.builtin.command: "{{ grub_mkconfig_command }}"
  when:
    - default_grub.changed
  vars:
    grub_mkconfig_command: >-
      {% set grub_command_map = {
        'Debian': 'update-grub',
        'Fedora': 'grub2-mkconfig -o /boot/efi/EFI/Fedora/grub.cfg\ngrub2-mkconfig -o /boot/grub2/grub.cfg',
        'Archlinux': 'grub-mkconfig -o /boot/grub/grub.cfg'
      } %}

      {{ grub_command_map.get(ansible_os_family, '# Unsupported distribution') }}

---

- name: Check if locate command is available
  command: locate --version
  register: locate_check
  ignore_errors: true

- name: Set locate_available variable
  set_fact:
    locate_available: "{{ not locate_check.failed }}"

- block:
    - name: Set directories to not be indexed
      template:
        src: etc/updatedb.conf.j2
        dest: /etc/updatedb.conf
        owner: root
        group: root
        mode: '0644'
        backup: yes
      register: updatedb_conf

    - name: Run updatedb
      command: "updatedb"
      when: updatedb_conf.changed
      ignore_errors: True

  when: locate_available|bool

---

---

- name: Base Tasks
  debug:
    msg: "Starting base tasks"
  register: expected_value

- import_tasks:
    file: packages.yml
  tags: ['packages']

- name: Ensure root directories exist
  file:
    dest: "{{ item.dest }}"
    state: directory
    owner: "{{ item.owner | default(omit) }}"
    group: "{{ item.group | default(omit) }}"
    mode: "{{ item.mode | default(omit) }}"
    recurse: "{{ item.recurse | default(false) }}"
  loop: "{{ root_directory_definitions }}"

- import_tasks:
    file: sshd.yml
  tags: ["sshd"]

- import_tasks:
    file: environment.yml
  tags: ["env", "profile"]

- import_tasks:
    file: grub.yml
  tags: ["grub"]

- import_tasks:
    file: updatedb.yml
  tags: ["updatedb"]

- import_tasks:
    file: ranger.yml
  tags: ['ranger']

root_directory_default_mode: '0755'

# The default directory owner when creating directories using `root_directory_definitions`
root_directory_default_owner: root

# handlers file for vscode

---
- hosts: localhost
  remote_user: root
  roles:
    - vscode

---

# - name: Check repository version
#   shell: "paru -Si code | grep -w 'extra/code' | awk '{print $2}' | sed 's/-1$//' | xargs"
#   register: desired_version
#   changed_when: false
#
# - name: Get installed application version
#   shell: "code --version | head -1 |awk '{print $1}'"
#   register: current_version
#   changed_when: false

- block:
    - name: Install vscode
      aur:
        use: auto
        name: "{{ item }}"
        state: present
      with_items:
          - code
          - code-marketplace
      register: vscode_install
      tags: ['packages']

    - name: Check currently installed extensions
      shell: code --list-extensions
      register: installed_extensions
      changed_when: installed_extensions.rc != 0
      ignore_errors: "{{ ansible_check_mode }}"

    # - name: something
    #   debug:
    #     var: extensions|difference(installed_extensions.stdout_lines)

    - name: Set list of extensions to install
      set_fact:
        _extensions: "{{ extensions|difference(installed_extensions.stdout_lines) }}"

    - name: Install VSCode extensions
      shell: "code --install-extension {{ item }}"
      with_items:
        - "{{ _extensions }}"
      when: _extensions | length > 0

  rescue:
    - name: Handle installation failure
      debug:
        msg: "Failed to install VSCode extension: {{ item }}"
      loop: "{{ ansible_failed_result.results | map(attribute='item') | list }}"

  always:
    - name: Continue execution
      debug:
        msg: "Continuing with playbook execution"

  become: False
  vars:
    extensions:
      - "10nates.ollama-autocoder"
      - "beardedbear.beardedicons"
      - "beardedbear.beardedtheme"
      - "bradlc.vscode-tailwindcss"
      - "byi8220.indented-block-highlighting"
      - "castwide.solargraph"
      - "darkriszty.markdown-table-prettify"

      - "leodevbro.blockman"

      - "miladfathy.html-color-theme"
      - "ms-azuretools.vscode-docker"
      - "ms-azuretools.vscode-docker"
      - "ms-python.debugpy"
      - "ms-python.python"
      - "ms-python.vscode-pylance"
      - "ms-toolsai.jupyter"

---
# handlers file for homepage

---
- hosts: localhost
  remote_user: root
  roles:
    - homepage

---
# tasks file for homepage


- name: Create homepage folder
  file:
    path: "{{ homepage_directory }}"
    state: directory
    owner: "{{ user.name }}"
    group: "{{ user.group }}"
    mode: '2755'
    recurse: False

- name: sync folder
  synchronize:
    src: home/.local/share/html/homepage/
    dest: "{{ homepage_directory }}/"
    recursive: yes
    mode: push
    delete: no
    checksum: yes
    perms: no
    rsync_opts:
      - "--update"
      - "--omit-dir-times"
      - "--progress"
      - "--itemize-changes"
      - "--chown={{ user.name }}:{{ user.name }}"

- name: Set index.html template
  template:
    src: home/.local/share/html/homepage/index.html.j2
    dest: "{{ homepage_directory }}/index.html"
    owner: "{{ user.name }}"
    group: "{{ user.group }}"
    mode: '0664'
    backup: False

---
# vars file for homepage

---
# defaults file for homepage

---
# handlers file for iso

---
- hosts: localhost
  remote_user: root
  roles:
    - iso

---
- name: Build Arch Linux ISO
  hosts: localhost
  become: yes
  tasks:
    - name: Set variables
      set_fact:
        src_dir: "{{ ansible_env.PWD }}"
        archiso_packages:
          - archiso
          - curl
      vars:
        installer_path: airootfs/usr/local/bin/installer
        cachyos_mirrorlist_url: "https://github.com/CachyOS/CachyOS-PKGBUILDS/raw/master/cachyos-mirrorlist/cachyos-mirrorlist"
      register: result

    - name: Ensure required packages are installed
      pacman:
        name: "{{ archiso_packages }}"
        state: present
      when: "'archiso' not in result.failed"

    - name: Copy installer locally
      copy:
        src: "{{ item }}"
        dest: "{{ installer_path }}"
      with_fileglob:
        - "{{ installer_local_path }}"
      when: installer_local_path is defined and installer_local_path | length > 0

    - name: Update installer remotely
      get_url:
        url: "{{ cachyos_mirrorlist_url }}"
        dest: "{{ installer_path }}"
        mode: 0755
        force: yes
      when: installer_remote_update is defined and installer_remote_update == true

    - name: Enable LTS kernel
      when: enable_lts_kernel is defined and enable_lts_kernel == true
      block:
        - name: Modify packages.x86_64
          lineinfile:
            path: packages.x86_64
            regexp: '^linux$'
            line: 'linux-lts'
          when: "'linux-lts' not in packages.x86_64"

        - name: Modify efiboot/loader/entries/*
          replace:
            path: "{{ item }}"
            regexp: '-linux$'
            replace: '-linux-lts'
          with_fileglob:
            - efiboot/loader/entries/*

        - name: Modify syslinux/*.cfg
          replace:
            path: "{{ item }}"
            regexp: '-linux$'
            replace: '-linux-lts'
          with_fileglob:
            - syslinux/*.cfg

        - name: Modify grub/grub.cfg
          replace:
            path: grub/grub.cfg
            regexp: '-linux$'
            replace: '-linux-lts'

        - name: Modify airootfs/etc/mkinitcpio.d/linux.preset
          replace:
            path: airootfs/etc/mkinitcpio.d/linux.preset
            regexp: '-linux'
            replace: '-linux-lts'

        - name: Modify profiledef.sh
          replace:
            path: profiledef.sh
            regexp: '"syncopated"'
            replace: '"syncopated-lts"'

    - name: Enable RT kernel
      when: enable_rt_kernel is defined and enable_rt_kernel == true
      block:
        - name: Modify packages.x86_64
          lineinfile:
            path: packages.x86_64
            regexp: '^linux$'
            line: 'linux-rt'
          when: "'linux-rt' not in packages.x86_64"

        - name: Modify efiboot/loader/entries/*
          replace:
            path: "{{ item }}"
            regexp: '-linux$'
            replace: '-linux-rt'
          with_fileglob:
            - efiboot/loader/entries/*

        - name: Modify syslinux/*.cfg
          replace:
            path: "{{ item }}"
            regexp: '-linux$'
            replace: '-linux-rt'
          with_fileglob:
            - syslinux/*.cfg

        - name: Modify grub/grub.cfg
          replace:
            path: grub/grub.cfg
            regexp: '-linux$'
            replace: '-linux-rt'

        - name: Modify airootfs/etc/mkinitcpio.d/linux.preset
          replace:
            path: airootfs/etc/mkinitcpio.d/linux.preset
            regexp: '-linux'
            replace: '-linux-rt'

        - name: Modify profiledef.sh
          replace:
            path: profiledef.sh
            regexp: '"syncopated"'
            replace: '"syncopated-rt"'

    - name: Enable RT-LTS kernel
      when: enable_rt_lts_kernel is defined and enable_rt_lts_kernel == true
      block:
        - name: Modify packages.x86_64
          lineinfile:
            path: packages.x86_64
            regexp: '^linux$'
            line: 'linux-rt-lts'
          when: "'linux-rt-lts' not in packages.x86_64"

        - name: Modify efiboot/loader/entries/*
          replace:
            path: "{{ item }}"
            regexp: '-linux$'
            replace: '-linux-rt-lts'
          with_fileglob:
            - efiboot/loader/entries/*

        - name: Modify syslinux/*.cfg
          replace:
            path: "{{ item }}"
            regexp: '-linux$'
            replace: '-linux-rt-lts'
          with_fileglob:
            - syslinux/*.cfg

        - name: Modify grub/grub.cfg
          replace:
            path: grub/grub.cfg
            regexp: '-linux$'
            replace: '-linux-rt-lts'

        - name: Modify airootfs/etc/mkinitcpio.d/linux.preset
          replace:
            path: airootfs/etc/mkinitcpio.d/linux.preset
            regexp: '-linux'
            replace: '-linux-rt-lts'

        - name: Modify profiledef.sh
          replace:
            path: profiledef.sh
            regexp: '"syncopated"'
            replace: '"syncopated-rt-lts"'

    - name: Fetch CachyOS mirrorlist
      get_url:
        url: "{{ cachyos_mirrorlist_url }}"
        dest: airootfs/etc/pacman.d/cachyos-mirrorlist
      when: cachyos_mirrorlist_url is defined

    - name: Build Arch Linux ISO
      command: "mkarchiso -v ."
      args:
        chdir: "{{ src_dir }}"

---

---
# defaults file for iso

---
# handlers file for sudoers

---
- hosts: localhost
  remote_user: root
  roles:
    - sudoers

---
# tasks file for sudoers

- block:

    - name: Ensure /etc/sudoers.d exists
      file:
        path: /etc/sudoers.d/
        state: directory
        owner: root
        group: root
        recurse: True

    # - name: Set NOPASSWD for user in sudoers
    #   lineinfile:
    #     path: /etc/sudoers.d/99-user
    #     line: '{{ user.name }} ALL=(ALL:ALL) NOPASSWD: ALL'
    #     validate: '/usr/sbin/visudo -cf %s'
    #     create: yes
    #     backup: yes
    #   when: user.name != 'root'

    - name: Set NOPASSWD for user in polkit
      copy:
        content: |
          /* Allow members of the wheel group to execute any actions
          * without password authentication, similar to "sudo NOPASSWD:"
          */
          polkit.addRule(function(action, subject) {
            if (subject.isInGroup("{{ admin_group }}")) {
              return polkit.Result.YES;
            }
          });
        dest: "/etc/polkit-1/rules.d/49-nopasswd_global.rules"
        mode: '0644'
      when: ansible_os_family == 'Archlinux' or ansible_distribution == 'Fedora'

    - name: Set NOPASSWD for user in polkit
      copy:
        content: |
          [set admin_group privs]
          Identity=unix-group:{{ admin_group }}
          Action=*
          ResultActive=yes
        dest: "/etc/polkit-1/localauthority/50-local.d/admin_group.pkla"
        mode: '0644'
      when: ansible_distribution == 'MX' or ansible_distribution == 'Debian'

  when: user.sudoers |default(false)|bool == True

---
# vars file for sudoers

---
# defaults file for sudoers
packages:
  - sudo

---
# handlers file for deadbeef

---
- hosts: localhost
  remote_user: root
  roles:
    - deadbeef

---

- name: Check if deadbeef is already installed
  stat:
    path: /usr/bin/deadbeef
  register: result
  ignore_errors: "{{ ansible_check_mode }}"

# - block:
#     - name: Install deadbeef
#       aur:
#         use: auto
#         name: deadbeef-git
#         state: present
#       become: False
#       when: ansible_os_family == 'Archlinux'
#
#     - name: Install deadbeef
#       dnf:
#         name: deadbeef-static
#         state: present
#         update_cache: yes
#       when: ansible_distribution == 'Fedora'
#
#   tags: ['packages']

- name: Create deadbeef config and plugin folders
  file:
    path: "{{ user.home }}/{{ item }}"
    state: directory
    owner: "{{ user.name }}"
    group: "{{ user.group }}"
  loop:
    - ".config/deadbeef"
    - ".config/deadbeef/playlists"
    - ".local/lib/deadbeef"

- name: Sync deadbeef plugins
  synchronize:
    src: plugins/
    dest: "{{ user.home }}/.local/lib/deadbeef/"
    recursive: yes
    mode: push
    delete: no
    checksum: yes
    perms: no
    rsync_opts:
      - "--update"
      - "--omit-dir-times"

- name: Set deadbeef configs
  copy:
    src: "{{ item }}"
    dest: "{{ user.home }}/.config/deadbeef/{{ item }}"
    owner: "{{ user.name }}"
    group: "{{ user.group }}"
    mode: '0644'
    backup: True
  with_items:
    - config
    - dspconfig

- name: Sync deadbeef playlists
  synchronize:
    src: playlists/
    dest: "{{ user.home }}/.config/deadbeef/playlists/"
    recursive: yes
    mode: push
    delete: no
    checksum: yes
    perms: no
    rsync_opts:
      - "--update"
      - "--omit-dir-times"

---
- hosts: localhost
  remote_user: root
  roles:
    - sonic-pi

---
# tasks file for sonic-pi

- name: Sonic-Pi Tasks
  debug:
    msg: "Starting Sonic-Pi tasks"

- name: Set configs
  template:
    src: "{{ item }}.j2"
    dest: "{{ user.home }}/.sonic-pi/{{ item }}"
    owner: "{{ user.name }}"
    group: "{{ user.group }}"
    mode: '0644'
    backup: yes
  with_items:
    - audio-settings.toml
    - colour-theme.properties
    - init.rb

- name: Install helpers and snippets
  copy:
    src: helpers/
    dest: "{{ user.home }}/.sonic-pi/"
    owner: "{{ user.name }}"
    group: "{{ user.group }}"
    mode: '0644'
    backup: yes
    # directory_mode:

- name: Clone ziffers repository
  git:
    repo:
    dest: "{{ user.home }}/.sonic-pi/ziffers"
    recursive: yes
    accept_hostkey: yes
    update: no
    force: no
  check_mode: no

- name: Ensure Thunar config directory exists
  file:
    path: "{{ user.home }}/.config/Thunar"
    state: directory
    owner: "{{ user.name }}"
    group: "{{ user.group }}"
    recurse: false

- name: Install Thunar actions
  copy:
    src: "Thunar/{{ item }}"
    dest: "{{ user.home }}/.config/Thunar/{{ item }}"
    mode: '0644'
    backup: yes
  with_items:
    - accels.scm
